page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: Almost two thirds of this block are covered by the sea and the other third is farmland. The land rises gradually from the waters of Udale Bay, giving beautiful views across the Cromarty Firth to Easter Ross and the now disused aluminium smelter at Invergordon. Out in the Firth, there are often oil rigs which come here to be repaired. The waters of the Firth are very often quite busy with the oil rigs and their repair vessels and with the Naval vessels which put into Invergordon. There are no villages or shops, though there is one garage and petrol station which is at the extreme end of the village of Jemimaville, and which serves a very large area of the Black Isle. The farming is of the mixed arable type, with beef cattle and sheep,as in the other areas of the Black Isle.
